metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4053 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A website could have obscured the full screen notification by using a URLwith a scheme handled by an external program, such as a mailto URL. Thiscould have led to user confusion and possible spoofing attacks. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 115.2, and Thunderbird <115.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '116.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
